text:
why do n't porn sites end with .xxx instead of .com ? would it not be more practical and " child friendly " ? Please explain like I'm five.  The .xxx top-level domain (TLD) was created specifically for the adult entertainment industry. It was intended to be a way for adult content to be separated from other content on the internet and to make it easier for people to identify and avoid content that might not be suitable for them. 
However, not all adult content websites have chosen to use the .xxx TLD. Some websites might prefer to use a .com TLD because it is more well-known and familiar to people. Others might use a different TLD for various reasons, such as marketing or branding considerations. 
Using a .xxx TLD might not necessarily make a website "child friendly," as it is still possible for children to access adult content through other means. It is important for parents to educate their children about internet safety and to use appropriate tools and resources to help protect their children from inappropriate content online.
output:
The .xxx top-level domain (TLD) was created specifically for the adult entertainment industry. It was intended to be a way for adult content to be separated from other content on the internet and to make it easier for people to identify and avoid content that might not be suitable for them. 
However, not all adult content websites have chosen to use the .xxx TLD. Some websites might prefer to use a .com TLD because it is more well-known and familiar to people. Others might use a different TLD for various reasons, such as marketing or branding considerations. 
Using a .xxx TLD might not necessarily make a website "child friendly," as it is still possible for children to access adult content through other means. It is important for parents to educate their children about internet safety and to use appropriate tools and resources to help protect their children from inappropriate content online.
instruction: why do n't porn sites end with .xxx instead of .com ? would it not be more practical and " child friendly " ? Please explain like I'm five.

text: ELI15 : How did ' cum ' rather than ' come ' become the coloquial spelling for ejaculate ? NSFW I guess ? See above Explain like I'm five.  It's not uncommon for people to spell words differently in casual or informal writing, and "cum" is an example of this. The word "cum" is short for "come," which is a verb that means to reach a particular point or state, or to arrive at a location. In the context of sexual activity, "come" can also refer to ejaculating, or the release of semen from the penis during orgasm. "Cum" is often used as a slang term in this context. It's not clear exactly how or why "cum" came to be used as a slang term for ejaculate, but it's possible that it may have originated as a shortened or altered form of the word "come." It's also worth noting that "cum" is not considered to be a proper or standard spelling of the word, and it should be avoided in formal writing.

The word "cum" is short for "come," which is a verb that means to reach a particular point or state, or to arrive at a location. In the context of sexual activity, "come" can also refer to ejaculating, or the release of semen from the penis during orgasm. "Cum" is often used as a slang term in this context. text:
what teams won super bowl  The Super Bowl is the annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL) in the United States. The winning team of each Super Bowl is awarded the Vince Lombardi Trophy. Here is a list of the teams that have won the Super Bowl:

Green Bay Packers (Super Bowl I)
Kansas City Chiefs (Super Bowl IV)
Dallas Cowboys (Super Bowl VI, XII, XXVII, XXVIII)
Pittsburgh Steelers (Super Bowl IX, X, XIII, XIV, XL, XLIII)
San Francisco 49ers (Super Bowl XVI, XIX, XXIII, XXIV, XXIX)
Oakland Raiders (Super Bowl XI, XV, XVIII)
New York Giants (Super Bowl XXI, XXV, XLII)
Washington Football Team (Super Bowl XVII, XXII)
Denver Broncos (Super Bowl XXXII, XXXIII)
Baltimore Ravens (Super Bowl XXXV, XLVII)
Tampa Bay Buccaneers (Super Bowl XXXVII)
New England Patriots (Super Bowl XXXVI, XXXVIII, XXXIX, XLIX, LI, LIII)
Indianapolis Colts (Super Bowl XLI)
New Orleans Saints (Super Bowl XLIV)
Chicago Bears (Super Bowl XX)
Seattle Seahawks (Super Bowl XLVIII)
Philadelphia Eagles (Super Bowl LII)
Kansas City Chiefs (Super Bowl LIV, LV)
Tampa Bay Buccaneers (Super Bowl LV)
San Francisco 49ers (Super Bowl LIV)
There have been a total of 56 Super Bowls played to date. The most recent Super Bowl was Super Bowl LV, which was played on February 7, 2021 and was won by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
output:
The Super Bowl is the annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL) in the United States. The winning team of each Super Bowl is awarded the Vince Lombardi Trophy. Here is a list of the teams that have won the Super Bowl:

Green Bay Packers (Super Bowl I)
Kansas City Chiefs (Super Bowl IV)
Dallas Cowboys (Super Bowl VI, XII, XXVII, XXVIII)
Pittsburgh Steelers (Super Bowl IX, X, XIII, XIV, XL, XLIII)
San Francisco 49ers (Super Bowl XVI, XIX, XXIII, XXIV, XXIX)
Oakland Raiders (Super Bowl XI, XV, XVIII)
New York Giants (Super Bowl XXI, XXV, XLII)
Washington Football Team (Super Bowl XVII, XXII)
Denver Broncos (Super Bowl XXXII, XXXIII)
Baltimore Ravens (Super Bowl XXXV, XLVII)
Tampa Bay Buccaneers (Super Bowl XXXVII)
New England Patriots (Super Bowl XXXVI, XXXVIII, XXXIX, XLIX, LI, LIII)
Indianapolis Colts (Super Bowl XLI)
New Orleans Saints (Super Bowl XLIV)
Chicago Bears (Super Bowl XX)
Seattle Seahawks (Super Bowl XLVIII)
Philadelphia Eagles (Super Bowl LII)
Kansas City Chiefs (Super Bowl LIV, LV)
Tampa Bay Buccaneers (Super Bowl LV)
San Francisco 49ers (Super Bowl LIV)
There have been a total of 56 Super Bowls played to date. The most recent Super Bowl was Super Bowl LV, which was played on February 7, 2021 and was won by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

text: How can one identify institutional accumulation of a particular stock using price and volume data?  Institutional accumulation of a particular stock can be identified by looking at price and volume data. Some indicators that may suggest institutional accumulation include:Increased volume: If the volume of a particular stock increases significantly over a certain period of time, it may indicate that institutions are accumulating the stock.Rising price: If the price of a particular stock is rising steadily over a certain period of time, it may indicate that institutions are accumulating the stock.Bullish chart patterns: Chart patterns such as breakouts, cups and handles, and ascending triangles may suggest that institutions are accumulating the stock.High relative strength index (RSI): A high RSI may indicate that a stock is overbought, which may suggest that institutions are accumulating the stock.Large block trades: If there are large block trades of a particular stock, it may indicate that institutions are accumulating the stock.It's important to note that these indicators are not necessarily definitive proof of institutional accumulation and should be considered in the context of other market conditions and factors. It's also important to be aware of the risks of investing in any particular stock and to do your own research before making any investment decisions.
output: Institutional accumulation of a particular stock can be identified by looking at price and volume data. Some indicators that may suggest institutional accumulation include:Increased volume: If the volume of a particular stock increases significantly over a certain period of time, it may indicate that institutions are accumulating the stock.Rising price: If the price of a particular stock is rising steadily over a certain period of time, it may indicate that institutions are accumulating the stock.Bullish chart patterns: Chart patterns such as breakouts, cups and handles, and ascending triangles may suggest that institutions are accumulating the stock.High relative strength index (RSI): A high RSI may indicate that a stock is overbought, which may suggest that institutions are accumulating the stock.Large block trades: If there are large block trades of a particular stock, it may indicate that institutions are accumulating the stock.It's important to note that these indicators are not necessarily definitive proof of institutional accumulation and should be considered in the context of other market conditions and factors. It's also important to be aware of the risks of investing in any particular stock and to do your own research before making any investment decisions.
instruction: How can one identify institutional accumulation of a particular stock using price and volume data?

text: Minesweeper I do n't get it no matter how hard I try . Explain like I'm five.  ah , I remember the days when I had no idea how to play minesweeper . The game actually breaks down into one mechanic , the numbers . The number indicate how many squares around it have a mine in them . xxx x1x xxx means that of the 8 possible squares , there is only one mine . When you have a situation like : xxx 111 xxx It means that all three 1s share the same mine because each 1 space can have only ONE mine around it . In this scenario , the mine would have to be in either the top middle or the bottom middle space ( but not both ) . It ca n't be in any of the corners because the middle 1 tells us that of the 6 possible spaces here there is only one mine . But if there was a mine in the corner , then either the left or right 1 would not have a mine next to it , which does n't follow the rules . another situation : 2x 3x 2x In this scenario , all three x 's are mines .
output: ah , I remember the days when I had no idea how to play minesweeper . The game actually breaks down into one mechanic , the numbers . The number indicate how many squares around it have a mine in them . xxx x1x xxx means that of the 8 possible squares , there is only one mine . When you have a situation like : xxx 111 xxx It means that all three 1s share the same mine because each 1 space can have only ONE mine around it . In this scenario , the mine would have to be in either the top middle or the bottom middle space ( but not both ) . It ca n't be in any of the corners because the middle 1 tells us that of the 6 possible spaces here there is only one mine . But if there was a mine in the corner , then either the left or right 1 would not have a mine next to it , which does n't follow the rules . another situation : 2x 3x 2x In this scenario , all three x 's are mines .
instruction: Minesweeper I do n't get it no matter how hard I try . Explain like I'm five.
